timeline.message:
Add support for LSPExtensions

This adds the ability to extend the list of commands supported by the GraalLS through other instruments that provide the new LSPExtension service.

timeline.bodyText: With Env this is quite powerful. This allows an arbitrary instrumentation and can potentially be abused. How it's used? Would some restricted access be sufficient?
timeline.author: entlicher

+/**

+
+    /**
+     * Get the name of the command.

replies.bodyText:
The Env object passed in is the envInternal and I exposed it because it is quite powerful. The idea of LSPExtensions is that they can parse, evaluate, and instrument code within the context of the GraalLS. Of course, we could hide some of Env's functionality similar to how the LSPServerAccessor hides information. For our tools, we currently only need #getInstrumenter(), #parse(), and #parseInline().
BTW: I wonder, can't other instruments just create Context objects through the Graal SDK and do arbitrary instrumentation? I mean all instruments must be trusted, right?
replies.author: fniephaus
